monogr.title: The doome warning all men to the iudgemente : wherein are contayned for the most parte all the straunge prodigies hapned in the worlde, with diuers secrete figures of reuelations tending to mannes stayed conuersion towardes God: in maner of a generall chronicle, gathered out of sundrie approued authors by St. Batman professor in diuinite
monogr.author: Lykosthenes, Konrad

div.head: The antiquitie of Englande first called Brutaine.
div.p:
BRute entred this Ilande, being the sonne of Siluius the son of Ascanius the sonne of Aeneas, after the deth of his father, a Gentile by lignage, and arriued at a place nowe called Totnes in Deuonshire the yeare of the Worlde. 2855. of continuaunce 2689. the yeare before Christs natiuitie. 1108. there he first beganne to settle himselfe and his armie, vntil he had subdued diuerse mightie people, tal and strong, tearmed Giantes, then as King he named this Ile Brytaine, or as some hath written Brutaine, whose race continued in kingly gouernement, vntill the time of Ferrex and Porrex two brethren, through whose discorde and bloudie conspiracie the linage of Brute was extinguished, when this Realme, by ye space of 616. yeres had bin gouerned: then from ye time of Mulmucius Dunwallo ye son of Cloten Duke of Cornewale, who was the first King that in this Ile ware a Crown of golde, vntill Cassibelan that was subdued by the force of Iulius Caesar, fiftie yeare
before the byrth of Christ, after which victorie the Brytaines became tributaries vnto the Romaines, and they as conquerors, helde the gouernement, vntill the time of Vortiger King ouer the Brytaines, whiche was the yeare after Christes incarnation 447. shortly after which season, the Brytaines, beside their seruitude vnder the Romaines, were maruellously vexed with the Scots, Pictes and Danes, nations that both robbed them of their goods, and slewe their people, notwithstanding al these grieuous plagues, by the means of a time of quietnesse, that happened in the time of Arthur king ouer the Brytaines and other whose valiant gouernement many yeares since hath bin slenderly estéemed, the sayde Brytaines became exercisers of lewde luste, ryotting and Idlenesse, which was the cause of their confusion, for God sent suche a plague and morrain, as wel among beasts, as men, that the liuing were not sufficient to burie the deade. And through the helpe of Scottes and Pictes, the Saxons subdued the Brytaines, in which greate dissention, the Danes became a plague vnto the Saxones: then was discorde in euery shire, and no manne sure what to possesse vntil the time of Edwyne the first Christiā king of Northumberland: in whose time there was no generall peace, but that the former rage waxed somewhat calmer, and so a lesser violence continued vntill William Duke of Normandy subdued the whole lande, by a general conquest, whiche was aboute the yeare of our Lorde God. 1066. the fourth day of October being Saterday, in the which sayde yeare was séene a blasing Starre, the sequele being considered, these Verses folowing make relation.

q.l: A thousande sixe and sixtie yeare
it was, as we do reade,
When that a Comet did appeare
And conquerde Herolde with his men,
and brought this lande to bale.

div.p: The Saxons by the helpe of Vortiger entred this lande, about the yere of our Lord 450. and there continued against the Brytaines and Danes, the space of 600. yeares. Thys last gouernement hath continued without conquest of any other nation from Anno. 1066. vntil this present yeare of our Lorde God .1581. the space of 515. yeares, God graunte vs happy continuaunce, with such care to auoyde those offences, for the which God gaue ouer former gouernements, that we in eschewing their leude liuings, maye be euermore defended, not onlye from the seruile sworde by conquest, but also and most specially from euerlasting Captiuitie.
